item.title: Mai Muting!
item.dc:creator: @Jorsa Jorsa
item.description:
@Jorsa wrote:

well tbh, muted should be a boolean, to save 3 bytes of data for a start.
and you only need a true or false answer.
muting the person when they logon, is clearly not a good move in any situation.
muting the person when they logon, when they are already muted, is even more pointless.

Read full topic

item.title: Mai Muting!
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Okay, ive added the commands… And they work because when muted, you can’t talk, or yell…

My problem is, that when you loggout, and back in, your not muted any more…

-=-=- ## -=-=-

Here’s what i have in my welcome message. or Login w.e.

		ResetBonus();
		GetBonus();
		WriteBonus();
		spellSet = 0;
                Poisoned = false;
		canSave = true;
		if (muted == 1) {
		sendMessage("You are muted and cannot speak!!");
		}
		else if(muted == 0) {
		muted = 0;
		sendMessage("Message");

Obviously it will go further but this is all you need really…

It used to look like this…

		ResetBonus();
		GetBonus();
		WriteBonus();
		spellSet = 0;
                Poisoned = false;
		canSave = true;
                          muted = 0;
		if (muted == 1) {
		sendMessage("You are muted and cannot speak!!");
		}
		else if(muted == 0) {
		sendMessage("Message");

Now that auto sets their muted to 0… So i thought. Wth lol. So i moved it.

Anyone got any ideas?

Read full topic
